key_insight: The paper introduces an end-to-end pipeline that converts a patient’s bulk RNA-seq profile into personalized small-molecule candidates by combining transcriptome-derived target selection with metaheuristic-driven de novo molecule assembly and target-aware filtering. This yields tailored drug leads for AML subtypes without relying solely on known mutations.
problem_solved: Addresses the lack of personalized therapeutic options for molecularly heterogeneous AML patients by linking individual transcriptomic signatures to de novo drug design workflows that prioritize patient-specific targets and multi-objective drug-like properties.
method: Patient-specific transcriptomics (TCGA-LAML) → network and differential expression analysis to nominate personalized actionable targets (e.g., WGCNA / driver gene prioritization).

Metaheuristic assembly (e.g., genetic algorithms / simulated annealing-guided fragment/SMILES assembly) to generate candidate small molecules conditioned on selected targets and structural constraints.
Target-driven in silico filtering: docking / target affinity prediction, multi-objective scoring for potency, selectivity, ADMET and synthetic feasibility to prioritize personalized leads.
impact: Demonstrates a practical AI/ML approach to close the loop between omics and de novo molecular generation, enabling researchers to produce patient-tailored drug hypotheses and accelerate preclinical prioritization using scalable computational workflows.
visual_elements: End-to-end pipeline diagram: transcriptome → target nomination → metaheuristic molecule assembly → multi-objective filtering → prioritized leads.
Patient-level heatmap/volcano plot showing differential expression and nominated targets across AML subtypes.
Schematic of metaheuristic assembly (population of molecules → mutation/crossover → fitness scoring) alongside example generated structures.
Multi-objective radar or bar chart comparing prioritized candidates on potency, selectivity, ADMET, and synthetic accessibility.
paper_title: Transcriptome-Conditioned Personalized De Novo Drug Generation for AML Using Metaheuristic Assembly and Target-Driven Filtering
paper_authors: Abdullah G. Elafifi, Basma Mamdouh, Mariam Hanafy, Muhammed Alaa Eldin, Yosef Khaled
